item.title: 上一季度，纽约超过三分之二的房屋销售是现金购买，创下了历史纪录，因为除了最富有的买家外，其他买家都对高抵押贷款利率望而却步。
item.description:
More than two-thirds of home sales in New York last quarter were cash purchases, a record, as high rates on mortgages deter all but the richest buyers. https://t.co/2KVijPNjw5 pic.twitter.com/X5D8qsfY2i

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：GB News 的所有者 All Perspectives 被迫再提供 4100 万英镑的资金，以支付亏损广播公司的运营成本。
item.description:
Breaking news: GB News owner All Perspectives has been forced to provide a further £41mn in funding to cover operating costs at the loss-making broadcaster. https://t.co/KpxDm9hlNN pic.twitter.com/1P3oWDr6fP

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：新加坡淡马锡控股公司（Temasek Holdings）正在就投资 OpenAI 进行谈判。这笔交易将标志着国家支持的集团首次向聊天软件制造商提供资金。
item.description:
Breaking news: Singapore’s Temasek Holdings is holding talks about investing in OpenAI. A deal would mark the first time a state-backed group has funded the ChatGPT maker https://t.co/ZsSJFChpFC pic.twitter.com/z9BKiIkLVb

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: 自 2023 年初以来，这所世界领先的英国大学的学者们已被列为至少五项研究的共同作者，这些研究的作者都是中国军工企业的核心人物
item.description:
Since the beginning of 2023, academics at the world-leading British university have been named as co-authors on at least five studies with figures at the heart of China’s military-industrial complex https://t.co/9Nb4io4qMN pic.twitter.com/vBtWZlYnZh

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: "肖尔茨在拒绝发射导弹的问题上缩手缩脚。他似乎不明白，他这样做就成了普京棋盘上最好的棋子。"
item.description:
“Scholz has hunkered down in his refusal to send the missiles. He doesn’t seem to understand that by doing that he’s become the best piece on Putin’s chessboard.” https://t.co/jWll2FURQX

— max seddon (@maxseddon) March 5, 2024

item.title: 在欧洲和中东战火纷飞之际，德国发生的窃听事件给奥拉夫-肖尔茨造成了严重伤害，引发了人们对德国政府通信安全的巨大担忧
item.description:
An eavesdropping affair in Germany has caused serious damage to Olaf Scholz, triggering massive concern about the safety of German government communications as wars rage in Europe and the Middle East https://t.co/IejArehMPW pic.twitter.com/ATu9EoJD0n

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: 如果您错过了中国将今年的经济增长目标定为 5%左右，因为这个世界第二大经济体要应对从房地产放缓到投资者信心疲软等各种挑战
item.description:
In case you missed it: China will target economic growth of about 5% this year as the world’s second-largest economy battles challenges ranging from a property slowdown to weak investor confidence https://t.co/0e1d9dn9QG pic.twitter.com/bTxJxcAtEx

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024

item.title: Grindr 首席执行官乔治-阿里森（George Arison）打赌公司能扩大吸引力，增加收入。有初步迹象表明，投资者与他一样乐观，自 11 月发布财报以来，该公司股价上涨了近五分之二。
item.description:
Grindr CEO George Arison is betting the company can broaden its appeal and boost revenues. There are early signs that investors share his optimism, with the stock rallying almost two-fifths since its earnings announcement in November https://t.co/C1cAS2DIiO pic.twitter.com/MCTnrtr0PU

— Financial Times (@FT) March 5, 2024
